results.title: Shadow play
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Children's Library and Craft Movement
results.brief_description: Children are given guidance in cutting-out and preparing figures for a shadow play. Children learn to make Japanese style flat paper puppets, after being shown a play at their Creative Leisure Centre in Brisbane. After deciding upon a story to illustrate, each child draws and cuts out outlines, gluing on lace, and paper doily frilly finishes and painting black for maximum effect. Finally scenery is fixed to the cloth screen, sound effects and puppets tried out and a bright light shone on the screen ready for the performance of St George and the Dragon, narrated by an instructor.

results.title: Shades of difference
results.creator_credit: Frank Heimans and Cinetel Film Production Services
results.brief_description: Displays and discusses the work of two Australian painters, with their own explanations and responses to the comments of a random selection of people asked to view their works. Michael Dulics uses pictorial symbolism as a vehicle for social commentary. Col Jordan creates abstract optical effects.

results.title: Sexually transmitted diseases (TEFC)
results.brief_description: An educational examination of sexually transmitted diseases, what they are, what the symptoms are and how easily they can be cured. The recurring theme is that most of the diseases can be completely cured if treated in the early stages. BEFORE SHOWING TO SCHOOLS IT IS ESSENTIAL THAT THIS VIDEO BE VIEWED BY TEACHERS FOR SUITABILITY.

results.title: Sexual harassment: the management perspective
results.brief_description: This program tackles sexual harassment from a management perspective; as managers and supervisors are the biggest offenders in cases of sexual harassment. The program looks at the effect of harassment on individuals, as well as how it effects the workplace. It covers visual, verbal and physical harassment, and stresses the importance of formulating and communicating a sexual harassment policy. The guide which accompanies the video covers definitions, consequences, setting and implementing policy, the complaint process, and a summary/case study.

results.title: Sexual harassment: the employee perspective
results.brief_description: The aim of this program is to provide employees with an awareness of the Sexual Harassment issue and the role organisations play in determining policy and action. The program gives insight into the issue by dramatising several realistic situations which constitute harassment and by stressing the need for co-operative effort to deal with it. The video is accompanied by a manual which may be borrowed as a separate loan item.

results.title: Sexual harassment
results.brief_description: This 13 segment video and guidebook dealing with sexual harassment in the work environment has been designed by psychologists, Eve Ash and Peter Quarry. Set in front of a studio audience including expert Barbara Wertheim, Commissioner of Equal Opportunity, and others who work in the area, this program looks at sexual behaviour, legal implications, effects on victims and strategies for deterring unwelcome advances. Includes four dramatisations of a man and a woman in harassment situations with follow-up discussions. Presented by Peter Quarry.

results.title: Sexism in the primary school (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Examines the hidden assumptions of school curricula and the ways in which teachers perpetuate sexist roles in children. A survey of sexism in traditional children’s literature is contrasted with a dramatisation of ‘St George and the dragon’ and observations of children at play are interspersed with comments by teachers with suggestions for a non-sexist and counter sexist curriculum
